titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records 1978.037
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:13:29 +0000.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company

did.abstract: The Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records span the period 1807 to 1875 and contain abstracts of laws authorizing the organization of the Brooklyn Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company, the building of the road, and laws closing portions of the road lying within the city in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn and Jamaica Plank Road Company records, 1978.037, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.
